doc.title: Going Attractions: The Rise and Fall of the American Drive-in Movie Theatre
doc.plot: Once a vibrant part of American culture, drive-ins reached their peak in the late 50s with over 5,000 dotting the nation from big cities to small rural towns. Although drive-ins are currently experiencing a resurgence, today only 400 remain. In a nation that loves cars and movies, why didn't drive-ins survive?
